did.abstract: The Oakland Methodist Episcopal Church was an active church in Pittsburgh's East End from 1878-1934. The Church eventually merged and is known currently as the First United Methodist Church of Pittsburgh. The records consist of six books, which have been microfilmed, that contain the records of members, pastors, baptisms, marriages, probationers, including the Church's history for the years 1872-1933.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: The Oakland Methodist Episcopal Church began in 1869 or 1870 as a Sabbath School held in the Bellefield Public School Building on Fifth Avenue in Pittsburgh. The organizer of the gatherings was William B. Evans. The Church as a congregation was organized by D.L. Dempsey, presiding elder of the Pittsburgh District, and Reverend J.C. High, City Missionary, on January 10, 1872. In 1873 the Church purchased property at Forbes Avenue and Bouquet Street from Edward W. H. Schenley and prepared for construction. The Church was finished and dedicated in September, 1878.

In the early 1900s the Church became a Wesley Foundation Church and functioned as a social and religious center for students of the University of Pittsburgh. At one time the Church had a membership of 350 full members and 250 Sunday school members or probationers. The Great Depression of the 1930s affected the Church by decreasing its. High budget deficits caused the Methodist Official Board's recommendation to consolidate Oakland Methodist Episcopal Church with the Christ Methodist Episcopal Church in 1934. In 1968 Christ Methodist Episcopal Church merged with Evangelical United Brethren to become the First United Methodist Church of Pittsburgh which still functions today.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of six books, which have been microfilmed, and contain the records of members, pastors, baptisms, marriages, probationers, and include the church's history for the years 1872-1933. Individuals in the membership records are listed alphabetically. Names in the marriage, baptismal, and pastoral records are listed in chronological order.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These records were microfilmed with the permission of the First United Methodist Church of Pittsburgh, PA in 1997.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: The originals are located in the archives of the First United Methodist Church.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Volume I contains a history of the church written in 1888, and lists of the church's probationers, classes, full members, pastors, statistics, baptisms, and marriages. All names are listed in chronological order except for the membership records which are arranged alphbetically. Probationer records contain the information of the individual's status, residence, member date, and gender. Class records are lists containing names of individuals enrolled in specific church classes. Pastoral records contain the name of the paster and dates served. Baptism and marriage records contain name, date, date of birth, parent names, residence, and place of birth.
